text: Dmitri Sychev is a Russian football player. He is currently playing for Lokomotiv-Kazanka Moscow. He has been called the "Russian Michael Owen" because of his fast pace and brilliant agility.UEFA profile page == Club career statistics == Club Season League Cup League Cup Europe OtherIncludes other competitions, including the Russian Super Cup Total Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Spartak Tambov 2000 16 3 — — — — — — — — 16 3 2001 26 6 1 1 — — — — — — 27 7 Total 42 9 1 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 43 10 Spartak Moscow 2002 18 9 1 1 — — — — — — 19 10 Total 18 9 1 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 19 10 Olympique Marseille 2002–03 17 3 1 0 2 1 — — — 20 4 2003–04 16 2 1 0 1 0 6 1 — 24 3 Total 33 5 2 0 3 1 6 1 0 0 44 7 Lokomotiv Moscow 2004 27 15 5 2 — — — 32 17 2005 21 6 1 0 — 2 2 1 0 25 8 2006 24 7 2 1 — 2 0 — 28 7 2007 29 11 5 4 — 5 1 — 39 16 2008 26 7 1 0 — — 1 0 28 7 2009 27 13 1 0 — — — 28 13 2010 27 8 1 0 — 2 1 — 30 9 2011-12 40 6 3 0 — 10 6 — 53 12 2012-13 3 0 1 2 — — — 4 2 Total 224 73 20 9 0 0 21 10 2 0 267 92 Dinamo Minsk 2013 11 0 2 1 — 2 2 — 15 3 Total 11 0 2 1 0 0 2 2 0 0 15 3 FC Volga 2013–14 16 0 — — — — 16 0 Total 16 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 16 0 Okzhetpes 2015 19 3 1 0 — — — 20 3 Total 19 3 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 20 3 Career total 363 99 27 8 3 1 29 13 2 0 424 121 == International career statistics == Russia football team Russia football team Russia football team Year Apps Goals 2002 6 2 2003 7 1 2004 8 7 2005 4 0 2006 3 1 2007 9 3 2008 8 1 2009 1 0 2010 1 0 Total 47 15 == References == Category:1983 births Category:Living people Category:Russian footballers
